awd_abstract_narration: This award provides funds to help purchase equipment which will                 improve the education of undergraduate students, both majors and                non-majors, at the University of Washington in organismic biology,              with primary emphasis on courses focusing on the biology of marine              invertebrates.  The specific equipment requested is a modern video              microscopy system, including mobile workstation with two compound               and stereo microscopes, high resolution solid-state cameras,                    instructor and classroom color monitors, and video cassette                     recorder.  This equipment will permit all students in the                       laboratory to participate simultaneously and interactively in the               same microscopy exercises and to address particular problems by                 live video presentations.  It will also permit storage and recall               of images including those of phenomena that can only rarely be                  captured.  The grantee is matching this award with non-Federal                  sources.
